moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 Qe7: A bad move, blocking the development of his f8-Bishop.
moves.4. Nc3: Probably better were 4. d5 or 4. dxe5. I wanted to continue my development.
moves.4... exd4 5. Nxd4 Qd6: Another bad move. Now c7 becomes a huge target.
moves.6. Ndb5: Launching an attack on the c7 square, now Black's defense becomes terribly difficult.
moves.6... Qe5: A bad blunder, the only move to prolong the fight was 6... Qxd1+ 7. Kxd1 Kd8. In this scenario, we have both lost castling right, and he has terribly bad development.
moves.7. f4: Removal of the guard. Now Black cannot defend c7 anymore.
moves.7... Qc5 8. Nxc7+ Kd8 9. Nxa8 Nf6 10. a3: Taking care of the Nb4 threat, now I can play Bd3 or Qd3.
moves.10... a5 11. Qd3: Threatening Be3. After 11... Qa7 (capturing the knight) 12. Be3 Qxa8 13. Nb5 Qb8 14. Bb6+ Ke8 15. Nc7+ his Queen won't breathe fresh air for a long time.
